item.title: Module 1: Basics of Excel
item.description: We shall use Microsoft Excel 2013 during the course. So I would suggest the class to install the 2013 version in their computers. Go through the syllabus uploaded in the university website. The references are given in the syllabus. In addition, go through the book Microsoft Excel 2013: Data Analysis and Business Modeling by Wayne L. Winston. 1.1 Introduction 1.2 Few other ‘must know’ things before you begin.

item.title: Module 2: Data Management
item.description: Contents 2.1 Data transformation 2.2 Importing and editing data from text files/documents 2.3 Creating named ranges 2.4 IF() statement 2.5 The COUNTIF(), COUNTIFS(), COUNT(), COUNTA(), and COUNTBLANK() functions 2.6 The SUMIF(), AVERAGEIF(), SUMIFS(), and AVERAGEIFS() functions 2.7 Sorting 2.8 Filtering and removing duplicates 2.9 Lookup functions 2.1 Data transformation In this lecture we shall cover: Data transformation: arithmetic operation- addition, subtraction, multiplication, log transformation, exponential, squaring and square root, indices.

item.title: Module 3: Descriptive Statistics
item.description: Contents 3.1 Univariate data 3.2 Multivariate data 3.1 Univariate data In this lecture video we shall cover the Measures of Central Tendency, Measures of Dispersion, treatment of outliers,rank with and without ties, and Moments and Order Statistics. Download the file Stock.xlsx used in the video and practice. Exercises: Use the data in the Stock.xlsx file to generate descriptive statistics for Intel and GE stock.

item.title: Module 4: Optimisation
item.description: This module will deal with optimisation problem using the Solver plugin in Excel. Download the file Prodmix.xlsx used in the video and practice. Exercises: Suppose your drug company can purchase up to 500 hours of labor at $1 more per hour than current labor costs. How can it maximize profit? At a chip manufacturing plant, four technicians (A, B, C, and D) produce three products (Products 1, 2, and 3).
There are no announcements as of now.
